name: Topic
title: Gcloud
Pubsub
Topic
description:
Topic

A named resource to which messages are published.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.publish "task completed"

methods.name: name
title: Gcloud
Pubsub
Topic#name
methods.description: The name of the topic in the form of “/projects/project-identifier/topics/topic-name”.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.delete

returns.description: Returns true if the topic was deleted.

methods.name: subscribe
title: Gcloud
Pubsub
Topic#subscribe
methods.description: Creates a new Subscription object on the current Topic.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
sub = topic.subscribe "my-topic-sub"
puts sub.name # => "my-topic-sub"

examples.caption: The name is optional, and will be generated if not given:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
sub = topic.subscribe "my-topic-sub"
puts sub.name # => "generated-sub-name"

examples.caption: Wait 2 minutes for acknowledgement and push all to an endpoint:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
sub = topic.subscribe "my-topic-sub",
                      deadline: 120,
                      endpoint: "https://example.com/push"

params.name: subscription_name
params.description:
Name of the new subscription. Must
start with a letter, and contain only letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers
([0-9], dashes (-), underscores (_), periods (.), tildes (~), plus (+)
or percent signs (%). It must be between 3 and 255 characters in
length, and it must not start with “goog”.

params.name: deadline
params.description:
The maximum number of seconds after a
subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should acknowledge
the message.

params.name: endpoint
params.description:
A URL locating the endpoint to which messages
should be pushed.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
subscription = topic.subscription "my-topic-subscription"
puts subscription.name

examples.caption: Skip the lookup against the service with skip_lookup:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

# No API call is made to retrieve the subscription information.
subscription = pubsub.subscription "my-sub", skip_lookup: true
puts subscription.name

params.name: skip_lookup
params.description: Optionally create a Subscription object without verifying the subscription resource exists on the Pub/Sub service. Calls made on this object will raise errors if the service resource does not exist. Default is false.

returns.description: Returns nil if the subscription does not exist.

methods.name: subscriptions
title: Gcloud
Pubsub
Topic#subscriptions
methods.description: Retrieves a list of subscription names for the given project.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
subscription = topic.subscriptions
subscriptions.each do |subscription|
  puts subscription.name
end

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Subscription::List#token)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
all_subs = []
tmp_subs = topic.subscriptions
while tmp_subs.any? do
  tmp_subs.each do |subscription|
    all_subs << subscription
  end
  # break loop if no more subscriptions available
  break if tmp_subs.token.nil?
  # get the next group of subscriptions
  tmp_subs = topic.subscriptions token: tmp_subs.token
end

params.name: token
params.description: The token value returned by the last call to subscriptions; indicates that this is a continuation of a call, and that the system should return the next page of data.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of subscriptions to return.

methods.name: publish
title: Gcloud
Pubsub
Topic#publish
methods.description: Publishes one or more messages to the topic.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
msg = topic.publish "new-message"

examples.caption: Additionally, a message can be published with attributes:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
msg = topic.publish "new-message",
                    foo: :bar,
                    this: :that

examples.caption: Multiple messages can be sent at the same time using a block:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
msgs = topic.publish do |batch|
  batch.publish "new-message-1", foo: :bar
  batch.publish "new-message-2", foo: :baz
  batch.publish "new-message-3", foo: :bif
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block for publishing multiple messages in one request

returns.description:
Returns the published message when
called without a block, or an array of messages when called with a
block.

examples.caption: Policy values are memoized to reduce the number of API calls:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
puts topic.policy["bindings"]
puts topic.policy["rules"]

examples.caption: Use force to retrieve the latest policy from the service:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
policy = topic.policy force: true

params.name: force
params.description: Force the latest policy to be retrieved from the Pub/Sub service when true. Otherwise the policy will be memoized to reduce the number of API calls made to the Pub/Sub service. The default is false.

params.name: new_policy

methods.name: test_permissions
title: Gcloud
Pubsub
Topic#test_permissions
methods.description: Tests the specified permissions against the Cloud IAM access control policy.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub
topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
perms = topic.test_permissions "pubsub.topics.get",
                               "pubsub.topics.publish"
perms.include? "pubsub.topics.get" #=> true
perms.include? "pubsub.topics.publish" #=> false

params.name: permissions
params.description:
The set of permissions to check access for. Permissions with wildcards (such as * or storage.*) are not allowed.

The permissions that can be checked on a topic are:

  • pubsub.topics.publish
  • pubsub.topics.attachSubscription
  • pubsub.topics.get
  • pubsub.topics.delete
  • pubsub.topics.update
  • pubsub.topics.getIamPolicy
  • pubsub.topics.setIamPolicy

methods.name: exists?
title: Gcloud
Pubsub
Topic#exists?
methods.description: Determines whether the topic exists in the Pub/Sub service.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
pubsub = gcloud.pubsub

topic = pubsub.topic "my-topic"
topic.exists? #=> true
